name: West Bond

trails_config.name: Lincoln Woods and West Bond Spur
trails_config.description: Widely considered the best sunset viewpoint in the White Mountains. Offers a deep-wilderness perspective of the Franconia Ridge and the Twin Range.
trails_config.parking_info: Lincoln Woods Trailhead, Kancamagus Hwy (NH-112), Lincoln, NH

current_conditions.ai_summary: A spectacular hike located in New Hampshire. Standing at 4540 feet, West Bond offers breathtaking views and a rewarding challenge for hikers of all levels.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4540 feet, West Bond is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Lincoln Woods and West Bond Spur**, a **20.5 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Bond**, which is just 0.6 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.

trails.name: Lincoln Woods and West Bond Spur
